0.title: US waives in-person interview for many visa applicants including students till Dec 31
0.article_body: The US has waived in-person interview requirements for many visa applicants through December 31, an official said. The applicants eligible for the waiver are students (F, M, and academic J visas), workers (H-1, H-2, H-3, and individual L visas), Culture and extraordinary ability (O, P, and Q visas). Eligible applicants must have previously been issued any category of US visa.

1.title: Romania to send arms, supplies worth €3 mn to Ukraine amid invasion
1.article_body: Romania will send equipment and supplies to Ukraine worth €3 million amid the Russian invasion, Romanian government has said. Provisions will include fuel, ammunition, bullet-proof vests, helmets, food and water. Additionally, ambulances will pick up pregnant women, the elderly and children waiting in queues trying to cross over from Ukraine into Romania at the northeastern Siret crossing point.

2.title: 90% in 15-18 age group received 1st vaccine dose in Delhi: Govt
2.article_body: Ninety percent of adolescents in the 15-18 age group have been administered the first dose of vaccine against COVID-19, according to official data. Until February 24, 54% of them had received the second dose of the vaccine, the data showed. The data was presented during a meeting of the Delhi Disaster Management Authority (DDMA) earlier this week.

3.title: JD(U) candidate Rohit Wahengbam shot at by unidentified persons
3.article_body: Janata Dal (United) candidate from Manipur's Kshetrigao, Rohit Wahengbam, was shot at by unidentified persons ahead of the Manipur Assembly polls and is reported to now be in a critical but stable condition in the ICU. "We do not know who tried to kill him but they should be caught. He was targeted out of political rivalry," said Wahengbam's mother.

4.title: Harshal needs to fine-tune slower balls in Dharamshala in 3rd T20I: Zaheer
4.article_body: Ex-India pacer Zaheer Khan has said India pacer Harshal Patel needs to "fine-tune" his slower deliveries to Dharamshala's condition without altering his approach and execution ahead of third T20I against Sri Lanka. "Dharamshala is a high-altitude ground as well so the ball also travels differently," he added. Harshal posted 4-0-52-1 in second T20I against Sri Lanka in Dharamshala.

5.title: I think Pak crowd will support me, they'll also hope we lose: Khawaja
5.article_body: Australia batter Usman Khawaja said that he anticipates the crowd in Pakistan to support him in the upcoming Test series but added the crowd will also want Australia to lose. "We've always had great support from Pakistan. I'm not sure how many of them will be turning up...But from all over the sub-continent, I've always had great support," he added.

6.title: MP's Ujjain to light up with 21 lakh diyas on Mahashivratri on March 1
6.article_body: Madhya Pradesh's Ujjain will reportedly be lit with 21 lakh diyas on Mahashivratri on March 1. Reports said city will be illuminated at 7 pm and the diyas will be lit for an hour. It will take 12,000 volunteers to light diyas. Ujjain District Collector said 15 lakh diyas were to be lit but were increased due to people's enthusiasm.

7.title: Had to wear 15kgs jewellery for song Chamma Chamma; got scratches: Urmila
7.article_body: During her appearance in 'Sa Re Ga Ma Pa', actress Urmila Matondkar revealed she got scratches on her body because she had to wear extremely heavy jewellery of about 15 kilograms for the 'banjaran' look in her song 'Chamma Chamma'. She added, "I got badly hurt by the earrings that I was wearing. I still remember it very clearly."

8.title: Ukraine to create 'IT army' to hit Russian websites
8.article_body: Ukraine is planning to launch an 'IT army' to strike Russia on the cyber front, said the country's Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov. "We are creating an IT army. We need digital talents," tweeted Fedorov. He also shared a list of prominent Russian websites, saying, "There will be tasks for everyone. We continue to fight on the cyber front."

9.title: Google blocks Russia's RT, other channels from making ad money
9.article_body: Alphabet's Google on Saturday blocked Russia's state-owned media outlet RT and other channels from receiving money for ads on their websites, apps and YouTube videos after Russia invaded Ukraine on Thursday. Russian media will not be able to buy ads through Google Tools or place ads on Google services. We'll take further steps if necessary, Google spokesman Michael Aciman said.

10.title: Horrific experience: Shabana Azmi on 21-yr-old niece left on bridge at night by Ola driver
10.article_body: Actress Shabana Azmi shared her 21-year-old niece's "horrific experience" where her Ola cab allegedly left her mid-ride on Mumbai's Dadar bridge in the night. "Driver realised...he'd reach home late due to traffic...so he made me get off on Dadar bridge," her niece said. "I had to walk down the bridge...It took me 2 hours to reach my destination," she added.

11.title: Stakhovsky to take up arms to fight Russia, says 'I've experience with a gun'
11.article_body: Former Ukrainian tennis player Sergiy Stakhovsky has enlisted himself in his country's reserve army amid war with Russia. "I would fight, it’s the only reason I’m trying to get back. I don’t have military experience, but I do have experience with a gun privately," he said. Earlier, Klitschko brothers took up arms to defend Ukraine against Russia.

12.title: Japanese billionaire donates $8.7 mn to Ukraine, says 'Met Ukraine Prez in 2019'
12.article_body: Japanese billionaire Hiroshi 'Mickey' Mikitani, the Chairman and CEO of electronic commerce company Rakuten, has donated $8.7 million to Ukraine. He called Russia's attack "a challenge to democracy". In a letter to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, Hiroshi said, "I vividly remember the early summer of 2019 as if it were yesterday when I visited Kiev and met with you."

13.title: Australian cricket team lands in Pakistan for 1st tour in 24 years, pics surface
13.article_body: Members of the 18-member squad picked for Australian men's cricket team's first trip to Pakistan in 24 years landed in Islamabad during the early hours of Sunday morning. Australia last played in Pakistan in 1998, winning the three-match Test series 1-0 and winning the ODI series 3-0. The upcoming Test series will be Pat Cummins' first overseas series as captain.

14.title: Don't want to be captain just for personal satisfaction, it is just a post: Bumrah
14.article_body: India pacer Jasprit Bumrah said he doesn't want to be captain just for personal satisfaction. "It's just a post...it's just a name, you've to do your job and you have to help people in the best way you can," he added. Bumrah further said, "Whatever role is asked of me I'd do it with the best ability that I can."

15.title: 26.11-carat diamond found by man in MP mine sold for ₹1.62 crore
15.article_body: The 26.11-carat diamond found by a brick kiln operator in Madhya Pradesh's Panna district was sold for ₹1.62 crore during an auction, an official said on Sunday. The brick kiln operator had found the diamond in a shallow mine. In the auction, 87 other rough diamonds fetched a total of ₹1.89 crore.

16.title: Russia's actions bear signs of genocide, kids will be killed subtly: Ukrainian Prez
16.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Sunday urged the world to scrap Russia’s voting power at the UN Security Council. He said, "They are going to bomb our Ukrainian cities, even more, they are going to kill our children even more subtly...Russia's criminal actions against Ukraine bear signs of genocide." Russian forces have entered into Ukraine's second-largest city, Kharkiv.

17.title: Ukraine govt shares pic of residential building shelled by Russia near Kyiv
17.article_body: Ukraine's Centre for Strategic Communications and Information Security took to Twitter to share a picture of a residential building shelled by Russian army. "Russia is committing war crimes. Today Russian army shelled a residential building in Bucha...15 km from Kyiv," it wrote. It also said that Russian tanks shot down a bus with civilians in Okhtyrka district of Sumy region.

18.title: Video shows cyclist being hit by explosive in Ukraine amid Russian invasion
18.article_body: CCTV footage has surfaced on social media that showed a cyclist being hit by an explosive in Ukraine amid the Russian invasion. The video showed the person being thrown from his bike after an orange flash was seen, seemingly from an explosive that hit him. Another video of the incident also showed him crawling from his bike before lying still.

19.title: Ukraine's former beauty queen joins fight against Russian troops
19.article_body: Former Miss Grand Ukraine Anastasiia Lenna has joined the fight against the Russian forces. Lenna, who was Ukraine’s 2015 representative in the Miss Grand International beauty contest, shared photos of her holding a gun. She also shared an Instagram Story featuring Ukrainian soldiers and wrote, "Everyone who crosses the Ukrainian border with the intent to invade will be killed!"

20.title: Ajith's 'Valimai' earns ₹100 crore worldwide in 3 days, Huma shares post
20.article_body: Ajith Kumar-starrer 'Valimai' has crossed the ₹100 crore mark at the worldwide box office within three days of its release. Huma Qureshi, who plays a character named Sophia in the action-thriller film, shared a tweet celebrating the film's milestone, writing, "Woo hoo! Thank you for all the love." 'Valimai' is directed by H Vinoth and produced by Boney Kapoor.

21.title: Means a lot to start new life from grandparents' house: Sheetal on wedding
21.article_body: Actress Sheetal Thakur took to Instagram to share video of her Himachal wedding with actor Vikrant Massey and said that it means a lot to her to start her "new life" from her grandparents' house. "It's a village or whatever people call it. But this is me," she said in the video. Sheetal and Vikrant got married on February 18.

22.title: Radhe Shyam makers install free astrology booths in cinema halls across India
22.article_body: The makers of Prabhas-starrer 'Radhe Shyam' have installed astrology booths in a lot of cinema halls across India. Every booth is equipped with an astrologer who'll read the palms of people free of cost. Reportedly, the booths have already been attracting massive crowds across the theatres. In 'Radhe Shyam', Prabhas, too, will be seen essaying the role of a palmist.

23.title: Amrita Rao shares edited 'Vivah' pic to wish Shahid Kapoor on birthday
23.article_body: Actress Amrita Rao took to Instagram to share a photoshopped picture from the movie 'Vivah' to wish her co-star and actor Shahid Kapoor on his birthday. "Happy birthday dear Shahid," she wrote. She reportedly also added the song 'Tum Jiyo Hazaron Saal' to her post. Shahid responded by saying, "Thanks so much, Amrita."

24.title: Shruti Haasan tests COVID +ve, says 'I'm on the mend, will be back soon'
24.article_body: Actress Shruti Haasan took to Instagram on Sunday to share that she has tested positive for COVID-19.  "Hi everyone! A quick not so fun update. Despite all safety measures I have tested positive for Covid. I'm on the mend and can't wait to be back very soon," she wrote. Several people wished her a speedy recovery.

25.title: 15 students from Telangana stranded in Ukraine return to Hyderabad
25.article_body: As many as 15 students from Telangana, who were stranded in Ukraine after Russia invaded the country, arrived in Hyderabad on Sunday morning. They were received by Shamshabad MLA Prakash Goud and a local corporator. "As per our information...second batch of students will be repatriated in Delhi. From there, Telangana-Andhra students will come to Hyderabad," DCP of Shamshabad said.

26.title: Words not enough to praise PM Modi’s role amid Ukraine crisis: Rajnath Singh
26.article_body: Campaigning in UP's Bairia, Union Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Sunday hailed Prime Minister Narendra Modi's role amid the Ukraine crisis. "Words are not enough to praise PM Modi for his role," said Singh. He also said, "Earlier, when India used to speak on global stages, the world didn't take it seriously. Now when India speaks, the world pays attention."

27.title: Ishan Kishan discharged from hospital, unlikely to play 3rd T20I
27.article_body: India batter Ishan Kishan, who was hospitalised after he was hit on the helmet by a bouncer during the second T20I against Sri Lanka in Dharamshala, has been discharged. "Kishan is under close observation of BCCI's medical team," a source told ANI. The source added that Kishan is unlikely to play the third T20I against Sri Lanka in Dharamshala.

28.title: Shreyas is aware that he might not start at T20 WC 2022: Karthik
28.article_body: Dinesh Karthik said India batter Shreyas Iyer has guaranteed a strong place in 2022 T20 World Cup squad following his performance in ongoing T20I series against Sri Lanka. "He's aware at...back of his mind...he might not start at...World Cup. But...first step is to put a seat on that flight," he added. Shreyas was adjudged 'Player of Match' in second T20I.

29.title: Finally contributing to team's success means a lot to me: Sanju Samson
29.article_body: India batter Sanju Samson, who batted for the first time in a T20I match since July last year, has said he's happy with his 39-run innings in the second T20I against Sri Lanka. "The rhythm wasn't there for the starting 10-12 balls...So I took a bit of extra time...finally contributing positively to the team's success means a lot," he added.

30.title: Mattress godown gutted in fire in Pune's Pisoli, no one injured
30.article_body: A mattress godown was gutted in a fire in Pune's Pisoli area on Saturday night. No injury was reported as all employees had left the godown in the evening. "We had deployed 10 fire tenders and it took about 2.5 hours to douse the fire," an official said, adding that the building was highly inflammable.

31.title: Chhattisgarh to generate electricity from cattle dung, agricultural waste
31.article_body: The Bhabha Atomic Research Centre (BARC) is going to help the Chhattisgarh government generate electricity from cattle dung and agricultural waste. Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel has asked state Principal Secretary Amitabh Jain to submit an action plan in two weeks "for scientific and systematic use of cow urine in the agriculture sector".

32.title: Ghaziabad civic body plans to revive 28 ponds before monsoon
32.article_body: Ghaziabad Municipal Corporation has announced that it plans to revive 28 ponds in its jurisdiction before the arrival of the monsoon this year. The civic body said that it has revived 10 water bodies so far. "The rejuvenation work may not directly help us in getting...drinking water...but it will...help us in...recharging of groundwater resources," the Ghaziabad Municipal Commissioner said.

33.title: Israeli billionaire to give oil, mining assets back to Congo
33.article_body: A company controlled by Israeli billionaire Dan Gertler will give control of valuable mining and oil assets back to Congo, the Congolese government has confirmed. The assets are reportedly estimated to be worth over $2 billion. Notably, the US had imposed sanctions on Gertler and several of his businesses in 2017 and 2018 for alleged corruption in Congo.

34.title: 14 shot at hookah bar in Las Vegas; 1 killed
34.article_body: As many as 14 people were shot at a hookah bar in US' Las Vegas. One of them died while two others are said to be critical. The shootout reportedly began following an altercation between two people at a party. "We're not sure exactly what kind of weapon was used, or if there were two shooters," said police.

35.title: 17,914 street children in India, highest in Maharashtra: NCPCR to SC
35.article_body: There are 17,914 street children or "children in street situations" across India, the National Commission for Protection of Child Rights (NCPCR) told the Supreme Court. The Commission added that Maharashtra has the highest number of children living on the streets at 4,952. Out of 17,914 children, 834 kids live on the streets alone.

36.title: 23-year-old man robbed of mobile phone at knifepoint by 4 men in Pune
36.article_body: A 23-year-old man was allegedly robbed of his mobile phone worth ₹40,000 at knifepoint by four unidentified men in Pune at around 1:30 am on Sunday. The incident reportedly took place when the man was standing and talking on his phone near his parked motorcycle in the Koregaon Park area. A case has been registered against the accused.

37.title: UP is crime, terrorism free; everyone feels safe: Minister Mohsin Raza
37.article_body: Uttar Pradesh minister Mohsin Raza, after casting his vote in Lucknow, said that the state is crime and terrorism free and that "everyone feels safe". "People are getting jobs. We've made UP economy number two and will also make it number one and people are voting for that. We are forming the government," he added.

38.title: 30-yr-old woman kills self in Punjab, blames husband in suicide note
38.article_body: A 30-year-old woman died by suicide in Punjab. She reportedly blamed her husband in her suicide note. The woman alleged that her husband beat her up daily and was responsible for her death. The woman's father said that she had married her husband in 2016 and the couple had a two-year-old daughter. The police have arrested the husband in case.

39.title: Bajrang Dal activist's killing must be treated as act of terror: Tejasvi Surya
39.article_body: BJP MP from Bengaluru South Tejasvi Surya said the Karnataka government must treat the Bajrang Dal activist Harsha's killing in Shivamogga like "an act of terror." A special unit should be set up to deal with such cases as the police alone are inadequate, he added. "Harsha's case must be prosecuted u/s UAPA and investigation must be comprehensive," Surya stated.

40.title: Gang involved in tyre theft busted in Hyd, tyres worth ₹29.64 lakh seized
40.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police arrested three members of a gang involved in the theft of tyres and recovered materials worth ₹44.72 lakh from their possession. Police seized 152 MRF tyres worth ₹29.64 lakh and other things. The gang members did a recce at truck factories and warehouses, and got into loaded vehicles posing as passengers seeking a lift, police said.

41.title: Gujarat's PSI suspended for allowing constables to travel in private car
41.article_body: Gujarat's Bharatnagar police station incharge MS Yadav was suspended from service on Tuesday for allowing the four constables killed in an accident on February 15 to travel in a private car. "We had permitted them to travel by train...the PSI allowed the constables to go to Delhi driving a car belonging to a private person," IGP Ashok Kumar Yadav said.

42.title: EC bans BJP’s UP candidate over 'go to Pakistan' remark
42.article_body: The Election Commission has banned BJP candidate from UP's Tiloi constituency, Mayankeshwar Sharan Singh, from making public statements for 24 hours over inflammatory speech. "If you have to live in India, (you will have) to chant 'Radhey-Radhey'. Otherwise, like all those who went to Pakistan during Partition, you can go too, you are not needed here," Singh had said.

43.title: Tesla Fremont plant toilets had racist symbols writings: Fired worker
43.article_body: A former Tesla employee, Marc Cage, has sued the firm alleging he was fired for reporting widespread safety violations and race discrimination at Tesla's factories. "Virtually every restroom in Tesla's Fremont facility contained writings or carvings of racist symbols and slurs," Cage said. He added Tesla employees denigrated and harassed him, with the knowledge of the management.

44.title: One day he started singing loudly in the hospital: Bappi Lahiri's son
44.article_body: When asked if Bappi Lahiri listened to music in the hospital, the late singer's son Bappa Lahiri said yes, adding, that one day he started singing loudly in the hospital. Bappa said his father was in the hospital for a large part of last month. "On February 14, he...kept saying 'ghar chalo ghar chalo' (Let's go home)," Bappa added.

45.title: Archer is one bowler I would like to face: 19-year-old Yash Dhull
45.article_body: India's 2022 Under-19 World Cup-winning captain Yash Dhull, who's currently playing in the ongoing Ranji Trophy, has said England pacer Jofra Archer is one bowler he would like to face in the future. "I would [also] love to make a partnership with David Warner [during IPL]," he added. Dhull scored twin centuries on his first-class debut for Delhi.

46.title: Muslims not happy with Samajwadi Party, won't vote for them: Mayawati
46.article_body: Bahujan Samaj Party chief Mayawati said that Muslims are not happy with the Samajwadi Party and will not vote for them. "People of UP have rejected SP even before voting as voting for SP means Gunda raj and Mafia raj. Riots happened in SP government. The face of SP leaders tell that they are not coming in power," she added.

47.title: Worked with dialect coach, had to get Bombaiya accent: Alia on 'Gangubai..'
47.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt said she started preparing for 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' with "basic technical preparations". "From voice modulation to getting...Gujarati characteristics...I had a dialect coach...Since she spent a lot of time in Mumbai...I had to get some Bombaiya accent," she said, adding, "I feel the actual preparations happen when you start enacting scenes...with try and error."

48.title: Karnataka reports 767 new COVID-19 cases; 552 in Bengaluru alone
48.article_body: Karnataka reported 767 new coronavirus cases on Tuesday, as per data provided by the state health department. Of the new cases, 552 were reported from the state capital, Bengaluru, alone. The state also reported 29 more coronavirus-related deaths, out of which 14 were reported from Bengaluru. The total number of active coronavirus cases in the city has risen to 5,255.

49.title: World's richest man Elon Musk dating 27-yr-old actress Natasha Bassett: Reports
49.article_body: Elon Musk, the 50-year-old Tesla CEO who's the world's richest man, is dating 27-year-old Australian actress Natasha Bassett, reports said. A few days ago, she was photographed leaving Musk's private jet in Los Angeles. Musk and Bassett were friends first and began dating after Musk's split with Canadian singer Grimes, with whom he had his son 'X Æ A-Xii'.

50.title: Rainfall warning issued for 19 states/UTs over next five days, list released
50.article_body: IMD has said that widespread rainfall is very likely over J&K, Himachal Pradesh and Uttarakhand during next two days and scattered rainfall for subsequent three days. Other states/UTs which may see rainfall over next five days are Punjab, Haryana, Chandigarh, Uttar Pradesh, Bihar, Jharkhand, Odisha, West Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal Pradesh, Meghalaya, Nagaland, Assam, Manipur, Mizoram and Tripura.

51.title: Putin is a 'genius', he is 'very savvy': Trump on Putin's Ukraine move
51.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump has called Russian President Vladimir Putin a "genius" for his decision to recognise two breakaway Ukrainian regions as independent. "Here's a guy who's very savvy...I know him very well," Trump added. Accusing US President Joe Biden of being "weak", Trump said, "This never would have happened had I been in office."

52.title: Russia's richest people lose $32 billion this year amid Ukraine crisis
52.article_body: The net worth of Russia's 23 billionaires has fallen by $32 billion to $343 billion so far this year amid the Ukraine crisis, as per Bloomberg. Gennady Timchenko, who's a close ally of Russian President Vladimir Putin, has seen his wealth disappear by almost a third this year. Meanwhile, Novatek shareholder Leonid Mikhelson's fortune has fallen by $6.2 billion.

53.title: Voting underway on 59 seats across 9 districts in 4th phase of UP Assembly polls
53.article_body: Voting for 59 Assembly constituencies spread across nine districts of Uttar Pradesh began at 7 am on Wednesday in the fourth phase of the polls and will continue till 6 pm. The fourth phase of polling will decide the fate of 624 candidates of Pilibhit, Lakhimpur Kheri, Sitapur, Hardoi, Unnao, Lucknow, Raebareli, Banda and Fatehpur.

54.title: HC issues notice to Delhi govt over PIL against CCTVs inside classrooms
54.article_body: Delhi High Court on Tuesday issued a notice to the Delhi government asking it to reply to a PIL challenging the decision to install CCTV cameras inside classrooms of Delhi schools and the consequent live-streaming of such video footage to third persons. The installation of CCTVs in classrooms without consent violates the right to privacy, the PIL states.

55.title: US imposes sanctions on Russian banks, elites; Biden says 'Invasion of Ukraine has begun'
55.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Tuesday said that the country was imposing a first tranche of sanctions against Russia, adding, "This is the beginning of a Russian invasion of Ukraine." Biden said the sanctions applied to VEB bank and Russia's military bank - Promsvyazbank, which does defence deals. Sanctions were also imposed against Russian elites and their family members.

56.title: Employee runs away with ₹14 lakh from gas agency in Pune, booked
56.article_body: An employee of a gas agency has been booked by Pune Police for allegedly running away with  ₹14,13,160 from agency. The employee was reportedly asked to deposit the money in the bank. A 43-year-old man, who owns the gas agency, filed a complaint in the case. A case under Sections 406 and 381 of Indian Penal Code has been registered.

57.title: 12-yr-old boy falls from terrace of 7-storey building in Mumbai, dies
57.article_body: A 12-year-old boy died after falling from the terrace of a seven-storey building in Mumbai's Vashi on Monday. He was playing on a trampoline kept on the building terrace when he lost control and fell on the ground floor, police said. The boy, who suffered multiple fractures, was taken to a hospital, however, doctors declared him dead during the treatment.
